name: Caffeic acid
desc: Caffeic acid is an organic compound that is classified as a hydroxycinnamic acid. This yellow solid consists of both phenolic and acrylic functional groups. It is found in all plants because it is a key intermediate in the biosynthesis of lignin, one of the principal components of plant biomass and its residues.

images.alt: 3D space filling model of caffeic acid

UV-vis (λmax): 327 nm and a shoulder at c. 295 nm in acidified methanol[1]
Related compounds:
Chlorogenic acid
Cichoric acid
Coumaric acid
Quinic acid
